duties_responsibilities.duty: Evaluate and manage invention disclosures, and develop licensing strategies.
Conduct outreach to industry and individuals for commercializing University-owned intellectual property.
Maintain a close working relationship with OTM and campus staff to fulfill federal compliance and IP protection obligations.
Develop and manage strong relationships with faculty inventors and prospective inventors.
Provide specialized advice and counsel on technology commercialization including disclosing inventions, screening and evaluation, and licensing.
Perform marketing responsibilities, including building and managing strong industry relationships.
Develop and deliver an annual Action Plan to enhance the disclosure pipeline and marketing of technologies.
Develop an annual Professional Development & Improvement Plan.
Train and mentor Associate Technology Managers and other support staff when needed.

education_certification.credential: PhD, Doctor of Medicine, Dentistry, Pharm D, JD with science background, MBA with Doctorate in relevant science. Foreign professional degrees are acceptable. Minimum (one) 1 year of relevant professional experience in business, academia, or government, including the licensing of technologies
